# TEXT Handler ‚Äì Plain Text and File Response

The **TEXT Handler** in OpenFusionAPI allows you to expose REST endpoints that return static text content with a configurable MIME type.  
This handler is ideal for serving plain text, XML, CSV, or other text-based files without any dynamic processing.

---

<details>
<summary>üß† How It Works</summary>

When an endpoint is configured with the **TEXT Handler**:

1. OpenFusionAPI returns the pre-defined static content as-is.  
2. The MIME type is set based on the configuration (for example, `text/plain`, `text/xml`, `application/json`, etc.).  
3. The handler supports all HTTP methods, but only **GET** is recommended since the content is static.  
4. The text content can be configured directly within the endpoint or referenced from an Application Variable.  

There is **no parameter substitution or dynamic binding** in this handler ‚Äî all responses are static.

</details>

---

<details>
<summary>‚öôÔ∏è Endpoint Configuration</summary>

This configuration screen defines the basic properties of the endpoint, such as method, path, access type, and caching.

![TEXT Handler Endpoint Configuration](data:image/png;base64,)

</details>

---

<details>
<summary>üìÑ Text Content Configuration</summary>

The main configuration defines:

- The **MIME Type** (selected from common types).  
- The **Text Content** (static string or value from an Application Variable).  

![TEXT Handler Content Configuration](data:image/png;base64,)

**Example Configuration:**

```json

  mimeType: text/plain
  content: Hello from OpenFusionAPI!

```

**Recommendations:**
- Keep the static text under 5 MB to ensure optimal response performance.  
- Use Application Variables only for small or reusable texts.  
- Avoid using this handler for large binary data.

</details>

---

<details>
<summary>üì§ Example Requests</summary>

Example: cURL (GET)

```bash
curl -X GET https://yourserver.com/api/demo/text/hello \
  -H "Accept: text/plain"
```

**Response (200 OK)**

```
Hello from OpenFusionAPI!
```

</details>

---

<details>
<summary>üîê Authentication & Access Control</summary>

The TEXT Handler supports all standard OpenFusionAPI access modes:

- **Public**
- **Basic Authentication**
- **Token-based Authentication (JWT)**

Since this handler serves static content, it is common to configure it as **Public**, unless sensitive information is exposed.

</details>

---

<details>
<summary>ü™µ Logging</summary>

Each request to a TEXT Handler endpoint is logged by the global OpenFusionAPI logging system. Logs include:

- Timestamp  
- HTTP method and path  
- Response size  
- Status code

Errors, if any, are also captured (for example, invalid MIME type or missing configuration).

</details>

---

<details>
<summary>üí° TODO</summary>

- Add support for **custom HTTP headers**, e.g., `Content-Disposition` for file download.  
- Option to include dynamic placeholders for runtime text injection.  

</details>

---

<details>
<summary>üìä Capability Summary</summary>

| Feature | Supported |
|---|---:|
| Common MIME types (text/plain, text/xml, etc.) | ‚úÖ |
| Custom MIME types | ‚úÖ |
| Dynamic parameters | ‚ùå |
| Caching | ‚úÖ (configurable per endpoint) |
| All HTTP methods | ‚úÖ (GET recommended) |
| Authentication modes | ‚úÖ (Public / Basic / Token) |
| Logging | ‚úÖ (global) |
| Custom headers | üöß (Planned) |
| Application Variables support | ‚úÖ |
| File-like responses | ‚úÖ (text-based only) |

</details>
